description: I have only tried their Chana(Choley) Bathura was i can say the BEST CHANA BATHURA IN THE BAY AREA.
author: Abhishek P.

description: I have to say, the food was quite good. We had for takeout the tandoori chicken (very tender!), saag paneer, and a lamb dish. All were very good! I recommend giving this place a try.
author: Mikey J.

description: Great location, surrounded by a ton of other cafes and restaurants. People are friendly here, reliable service, good unlimited chai with the lunch buffet. Got here with a friend around 1:30pm for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and I was sorely disappointed. There was still plenty of food, and maybe it was late in the afternoon so things had evaporated... but the food was very overcooked and way too salty.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Good for what it is, a really cheap Indian buffet. 

2.5-3 stars for food quality (vegetarian dishes were better). Undersalted. Dry. Bigger. Just gross. 
Minus 1 for hair and subpar service. 

I think all bathrooms should be mandated to have paper towels-- disease control all lie with hand hygiene after all.

If you're looking for quality, clean Indian buffet with good ambience, for cheap ($13) check out India clay oven. It's impressive
author: J P.

description: Food was ridiculously spicy. Being of Indian background myself, I'm used to spicy food, but this was inedible. When I tried calling the restaurant to let them know, they didn't seem to care and told me they would call me back. Poor quality and will not be ordering again.
author: Jane D.

description: Called ahead of time to enquire about space for a group of 4 and was shown the door as they received last minute reservation for a larger group. Had driven 45 mins to be here and had even paid for parking. Will never come here again. Highly unprofessional!
author: Sonal B.

description: I fuck with this place hard. Always have and always will. Yelp insists I keep writing until it's log enough so here I am writing over and over again. I think it's long enough now. Thank you for reading
author: Tom M.

description:
We treated ourselves to a dinner delivery on Christmas Eve and literally I could write the exact same review. 

We actually had the same food! I was absolutely delicious and we still have leftovers. Everything was perfection.

I highly recommend this restaurant. It's been our stay at home special occasion place for many years and never fails.
author: Sharon J.

description: I live a few blocks from this place and it is awesome. I'm a vegetarian and I always order the Chana Masala, Saag Paneer, and Dal Makhani and they are delicious. Indian food is one of my favorite kind of foods, I've been to so many restaurants and this place really does it well.
author: Lauren M.

description:
I went to Great India with some co-workers to try their lunch buffet.  And to be clear this review is only in regards to their Lunch Buffet.  

For $10, it's a great deal.  So much food!  Great if you're vegetarian too because they had a lot of vegetarian selections.  Unfortunately, since it was a meatless Lent Friday for me, I didn't get to try a lot of their chicken dishes like their chicken tikka masala and chicken tandoori.

Despite not being able to try their meat selections, I thought their veggie options were still very filling and flavorful.  I had a lot of their chana masala, saag paneer, and mushroom stew.

Overall, the buffet was okay.  I probably would've had more satisfaction had I tried their meat selections, but I'm glad they had enough veggie options for me to get by on meatless Lent Friday.  I wouldn't mind coming back again and with no restrictions next time.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I was actually impressed with this buffet! Good food at a good price. The salad was a bit old and wilted (and brown :( ), but the naan, the chai tea, the curry selection exceeded my low expectations. I think it's definitely a decent place to grab a quick lunch, and will be adding it to my lunch rotation. Kind service and staff as well. 

Don't come expecting stellar Indian food. But come if you're in the mood for some homey and comforting curry and warm naan. Eating there reminds me of simpler times, which I don't I really understand since I'm a Taiwanese American female who grew up in the south. But I'm okay with these false memories as long as it means I'm enjoying food that makes me happy. :)
author: Sophia L.

description:
It's the last choice to make for Indian place. There was a huge lack in taste of the dishes. Something was missing. 
There are only limited items as they read crowd that comes in...
author: Victor D.

description: 15 minutes after I order they call me back and tell me they are too busy and I live too far away even though i'm in their delivery area.  Must be nice to be that busy that you can just decide not to serve someone after taking their order (and money)
author: P K.

description: Food is not too bad, made us feel like home. We ordered tikka masala chicken and fish curry. Just that the portion of the meal was not big enough for us that we had to ask for rice refill. We ordered spicy tikka but it came out medium spicy instead. So these made the cut on rating
author: Stacey W.

description:
Tasty chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and masala tea. Note to self: order medium spice next time instead of mild. 

Fast delivery, hot and delicious food, decent prices. Definitely a must try.
author: Nina X.

description: Been here several times and always liked their food. Dum Aloo and Saag paneer is a must try. Didn't like their buffet since they have very limited options compared to other. Parking tip: park on 25th avenue which has free street parking.
author: Maulik S.

description: My friend and I ordered the Tandoori mixed grill and the steamed rice through Uber Eats. Let me tell you honestly it was the worst Indian food I've ever had, in this city or otherwise. The rice shown in the picture looks freshly steamed, with bits of herbs and green onions. The rice that arrives tastes dry like it was cooked the night before and microwaved before packaged, and has nothing in it to flavor, it's literally just rice. The meat in the mixed grill was so dry we couldn't eat it-- the shrimp tasted strongly of ammonia so we spit it out. Everything got tossed. I'm not sure if it was a bad night for them, but I can't imagine how they are still in business from the order that we had. $22 ended up in our trash last night.
author: Virginia J.

description: I've ordered delivery a few times from this place. You can't beat the quality of the food and delivery for the price!
author: Leonora H.

description: Loved the buffet, such authentic tasting Indian food. It had dal, rajma, chai, cabbage, aloo and more. So many options for vegetarians is amazing!
author: Aashali S.

description: Ordered from Uber eats and the chicken tikka and naan were pretty good.
author: Ken B.

description: Over an hour for delivery of rancid swill. With so many Indian restaurants to chose from, make a different choice.
author: Christopher C.

description: Food sucks. Restaurant smells, bad service. What else is there to say? I definitely had better.
author: Danny W.

description:
This place is great. We've been ordering take out here for a while and it's always fast fresh and fast. My favorites are daal and saag paneer. Very flavorful and tastes homemade. 

Update 4/22: my boyfriend and I order Indian food all over town (he's Indian), and of all places this is becoming my favorite Indian restaurant in the city. They have the BEST Daal Tadka I've ever had. Sooo much flavor. A vegetarian's dream. I don't know which dish is better that, or the Vegetable Coconut Curry. Both amazing. Their Malai Kofta is really good too. Thanks for making great food.
author: Tatyana V.

description:
I have eaten from here several times and I think that the food tastes great.

However, I just have had the worst delivery/customer experience of my entire life.

Tonight I ordered delivery takeout. My employer gives me $20 gift cards to this restaurant every month. Tonight I ordered delivery to my office since it was a late night at the office. When I ordered I tell them I will be paying cash, and I have $40 (20x2) worth of gift cards, and will pay the remainder in cash.  The delivery man comes in 25 minutes, which is in the window I was told I should expect. I present the $40 of gift cards and a $20 dollar bill for the remainder of approximately $3. I planned on giving a $4 delivery tip. The deliveryman has no change. He calls the manager and says I can pay with credit card. I tell the manager on his phone I would like to pay the remainder $3 plus add a $4 delivery tip. The manager on the phone says $10 minimum. I explain that the deliveryman can't even break a $20 bill, and this is a customer service issue. He says again $10 minimum. I explain again that I can't justify a $7 delivery tip on a $43 cash order to someone who can't make change for a twenty. I do have three dollar bills in my wallet, short a couple of cents from the exact of the roughly $43.xx. I pay and he leaves. 20 minutes go by and I get a call saying they incorrectly billed me and need $2 more. They say it was because I asked for a discount. I never asked for a discount, I said I had two gift cards.  I agreed to pay the $2, a mistake on their end, but said they would need to break a 20. They said they could. I said I would leave the office in 45 minutes. They said they would be there in 20 minutes for their $2. An hour goes by since I had more work than I thought and I leave the office. I call the restaurant and told them I was leaving and to call off the deliveryman collecting the two dollars.  They said they would call him and notify him to not come. 

20 minute later he calls me and says he is at my office and where I was. I told him I left and notified his manager to contact him. He cussed at me. I had a 13 hour day at work with no breaks, this was the breaking point. I cooperated with their measly $2 mistake by agreeing to pay. I am not sure why my employer gets these $20 gift cards, but I will notify them not to do business with them tomorrow.
author: Ryan A.

description: First time eating here today. Husband ate from the buffet and he loved it. I ordered from the menu and my dish was delicious. Staff was very helpful and friendly.  Nice laid back place.  We will be coming here again. Thumbs up for this place!
author: Marie M.

description: Very good food.  I loved everything I had.  Reasonable prices too. Delivery time was quick and they remembered to bring me some plastic ware (I was staying in a hotel).
author: Lisa M.

description: So it's been forever and a day since I've been here. Probably 2 to almost 3 years since I've been and I have again ordered the Chicken Thali dinner with the chicken vindaloo. I always switch between the vindalooand the tikka masala chickens. Amazing food and always consistent.  I have yet to try another dish but I love the thali dinners so much. The wait staff is always friendly and always make sure we are doing okay. My friend and I also ordered the pompadon appetizer which is a round crispy Indian type chip with different dipping sauces. Always get it and its wonderful.
author: Jesslyn H.

description:
Pros: All you can eat lunch buffet

Cons: flavors are sub par

In and area and with time. I stopped in to give this place another go. They did have better naan this time. However the amount of food available was pretty pethatic.

The buffet starts at 1130 and I came in at 1230. 

The chicken curry available was about 80% thick curry and 20% chicken. I took some and the person after me took the rest. Which again wasn't much to begin with.

Instead of replacing it. They simply stirred it up some more.  

I won't give this place a third try but your welcome to.
author: Nathan A.

description:
If you want REAL Indian food, check this place out. My wife is from India, so I know the difference. They're clean and authentic. I ordered lamb tikka masala, and it was amazingly tender and flavorful. We also got butter chicken, mango lassi and paneer naan. Everything was great. 

I saw some other reviews said they had bad service, but I think the service was wonderful. They didn't speak much English--but that's because they are Indian folks who know how to make the real deal. I asked for a few extra things with my meal that I normally have in India, and they gladly made special preparation for me. 

Also, one reviewer claimed that the restaurant is not authentic and that they have bones in the food. They obviously haven't spent enough time in India because there are bones in the food more times than not. It just shows that this place is authentic. 

I would definitely come again if I lived here!
author: John A.

description:
Ordered delivery through Grubhub. Don't know whether to yell or cry. Hands down the absolute worst Indian food I have ever had in my life by a long shot! Food was beyond terrible. Absolutely no taste for the lentil soup and coconut lamb. No seasoning, no salt, nada. As a matter of fact, I didn't even really get any lamb. I got a cup of watery tasteless slop with maybe 1 piece of lamb chopped up into 4 small pieces floating in it. Chicken tikka masala was nothing but a cup of watery tomato sauce and like the lamb, the chicken was missing. Just 3-4 small pieces floating in tomato slop. I paid $40 for 3 cups of watery tasteless slop, no lie. I'm beyond pissed off and feel so ripped off. Just gross and rude. 

How dare this establishment rip their paying customers off with such carelessly prepared food! Highway robbery. I wish Grubhub would drop this place because it makes them look bad. Never again, I want my money back. If you want good Indian delivery, Golden Gate Pizza and Masala in the sunset for the win. This place is garbage.
author: Irina S.

description:
This place is pretty solid for delivery indian food. My order always arrives well before they say it will (yay!) and the food is great. I recommend the Coconut Vegetable Curry, Chana Masala, Chana Saag or Aloo Gobhi Masala. It's not the best indian food in the world, but we aren't comparing this to a michelin restaurant. Delivery is fast, food is delicious, and it's hands down the best value you'll find- for $12 you can easily feed 2 people. 

Just a note-- Indian food is traditionally vegetarian. Order a traditional dish. You won't miss the meat and they do vegetarian very well!
author: Hannah B.

description: Love ordering take out from here! The flavors are on point.  I dream of the naan combo!!!! The masalas are delicious as the soups and basmati rice!!  Definitely recommend especially compared to the other options in the Richmond!
author: Jenny B.

description: I prefer this restaurant in outer Richmond. The buffet lunch is offerable and there are many vegetarian options and the chicken Tikka masala is very good even I have tried. The service is good. They are more friendly. I stayed in 28th Ave. The delivery also fast as soon as. This restaurant is my first choice in bay area.
author: Kumar V.

description: Consistent phenomenal customer service and food. That simple. It's been a couple years and I haven't even explored the menu that much, always naan and tiki masala
author: Spencer K.

description:
Ordered delivery from here for the first time last night- chili paneer, chicken tikka masala, rice and naan. All tasted okay (not great, but okay) but made my 10 year-old son and I violently ill! We are both out of school/work today as our bodies rid themselves of all of it. 

Needless to say we obviously won't be ordering from here again.
author: Emmy C.

description: Buffet was fantastic! Went for lunch break with coworkers on a Sunday and we could hardly work the rest of the day, couldn't stop eating. Good vegetarian options, too.
author: Robbie D.

description: We had saag paneer, biryani and chana masala nothing disappointed us. Food was good and bread was freshly prepared.
author: Jyoti K.

description:
Ordered saag paneer and dal makhani and naan through Eat24.  Food was at my door 26 minutes after ordering and it was SO GOOD.  I have been hunting across SF for an Indian restaurant that makes a really delicious dal makhani and finally found one!!  So good, so fast, and the medium level of spiciness was just perfection.  

I cannot wait to order again!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Just ordered takeout from here and I have it say it was incredibly disappointing. 

The best part of the dinner is the Mango Lassi. 
The kasmeeri nan is dry with huge anise seeds which have been cutting into our gums. The rice is ok but full of obviously frozen vegetables, cubes of carrot, green beans, and corn...things I've never had in my normally delicious Indian rice. The rice is also overlooked and too soft. 
We ordered two curries, Chicken Coconut Curry and Chicken Korma. The chicken korma doesn't taste remotely like the 20 or so entrees I've had in my life, the sauce isn't right. 
The chicken is fatty and birdy. My boyfriend said he bit into something he's never experienced with chicken before. It squelched. The actual sauce is ok but mixed with the rice it's mediocre at best. 
Needless to say I wish I could have my $36 back, and had just ordered dominos. We will not be ordering again.


Edit: My boyfriend found a large inch long bone in his chicken Korma. A Bone. 

We called the restaurant and they said it was not their fault because their vendor sends the frozen chicken that way. They refused to give us a refund and wanted to send more good. We have never had such a hard time making it clear that is not ok. After talking to three different employees we were able to get a partial refund for the dinner, but still not sure they even understood us. I'll be checking my card statement.
author: Larissa S.

description:
Got delivery and was severely disappointed.  
I ordered:
- vegetarian samosas, nothing special.
- vegetable coconut curry, lacking flavor and little sauce due to massive chunks of potatoes     
     thrown in.  Also yellow squash was in this, which did not seem fitting.
- side of rice, hard to believe the rice wasn't even good
- side of chapatti, meh really didn't even enjoy it.

Unfortunately, this was the most underwhelming experience of eating indian food and everything lacked flavor and was just really bland.  Like another reviewer said, the only thing I enjoyed was the tamarind sauce, which I was given more to drench the food in to give it some appeal.
author: Devin T.

description:
We went to this restaurant, no body attended us and not even served water. My family was very disappoint and we had two kids with us asking for water we waiting for almost 45 minutes no one came 

The worst service I have ever seen in my life, will never go to this place again.
When we were about to leave the restaurant not even one person ask what happened why your leaving 
So I recommend to people not to go there and waste your time waiting for them 
Again this place serves is wrest service ever
author: Anil R.

description: I order from Great India on an almost weekly basis and it's always delicious. I usually order lamb dishes and there's always plenty of it, and very tender. Plus, the people who own the place are very nice. Happy to have this place within walking distance of my house.
author: Amanda N.

description:
I have been to plenty of Indian restaurants in the city but this is The worst Indian food I have ever had. We decided to give this place a try because we saw a bunch of people in the restaurant one day. (Indian people) so we assumed that they had really good Indian food.  When we were there we ordered fish curry, Gobi Aloo, Sag Paneer, Lamb Vindaloo,  biryani and naan. (just in case you think we had couple bad dishes) 

First of all I order Lamb Vindaloo in all the Indian restaurant because that is my absolute favorite.  I make it at home at lease couple times a month. Their Lamb Vindaloo taste like three cubs of lamb cooked in tomato sauce. Vindaloo suppose to have over 10 different types of spices and strong taste of turmeric in the end.  It suppose to be spice, sour, and savory. There was no spices in the sauce. It was $14 for three pieces of lamb in tomato sauce with three other pieces of potatoes.  Worst Vindaloo attempt ever. 

Sag Paneer was okay. 

Biryani was flavorless. would have been nice if they put any kind of spices in the rice. 

Gobi Aloo was Okay 

Fish Curry didn't have any curry flavor.  It was couple pieces of fish cooked in tomato sauce.

It would have been okay if they were Chinese people trying to make Indian food but they were all Indian.  How can they possibly serve this crap to people.  Btw, they were serving Chinese spring rolls.  It's just the lack of effort that pisses me off about this restaurant.  Way better Indian food down the street at Clay oven. or Star India off 1st and Geary.
author: Daniel D.

description: I went to the buffet for $9.99. The curries were pretty bland. The naan isn't as crisp as I wanted. Unfortunately nothing was spicy. The dessert is a must taste. The watermelon and salad were fresh. All in all, I liked the textures of the food but the flavor wasnt authentic.
author: Lara H.

description:
I ordered from this restaurant because I had a gift certificate. I noted that it is nice that delivery is free and until 22:30. Kudos to the delivery driver who actually came inside the building too! However, I realized after opening my order that I did not receive two of my items, despite that I had them repeat back the order before we hung up initially. 

That's when I discovered that this restaurant has the WORST customer service. The man I spoke to barely spoke English, hung up on me twice, and kept repeating himself that I had actually received everything like he thought he was a real-life Jedi.

In detail: When I called to let them know the items were missing, they of course did not answer because by this time it was a few minutes after 22:30. Then when I called the next day once they opened for lunch, he asked me accusatorially why I didn't call sooner if I was missing items yesterday. After I explained that, he just started repeating "We checked the order twice. You received everything," occasionally throwing in a comment that really annoyed me, "Please don't do like this." I believe I spoke to the same person the night before and the next day, and his English was so poor that sometimes it was hard to tell when he was just being a jerk and when he was literally not comprehending. Ultimately, I asked his name and to speak to someone else. He claimed he could not spell his own name (Mani? he only mumbled it as fast as possible) and had the audacity to tell me that nobody else worked in the restaurant, ever. 

I finally called back later in the day (nobody called me, as I had requested) and reached someone else who was much nicer (Paul?). The hilarious thing was that the jerk actually tried to take the phone away after a minute ("thank you for waiting"--in the middle of the new, normal productive conversation) and I had to make him give it back. Paul's English was only a little better but he did have the courtesy to interact with me the way normal sane people usually do with customers. Finally, he said next time I ordered to remind them and they would give me the two missing items for free. Unfortunately, I don't think there will be a next time. I am just glad I had the certificate or I would be much more upset about the loss.

As for the food, the malai kofta was flavorful and arrived hot, and the medium spice was a perfect amount of heat in the flavor. That was the only good thing about the whole experience. The breads I ordered (keema naan, pratha, and onion kulcha) left quite a bit to be desired. I am pretty sure I received naan instead of pratha--pratha is delicious and buttery and flaky-layered, and is described the same on their website: "velvety layered". What I received was dry, thin, and almost a little burnt. Maybe it was a terrible chappati because the jerk on the phone tried to tell me it actually was pratha because "pratha is just wheat bread." So upsetting. But I certainly hope that it was not a true sampling of their pratha. The onion kulcha was fine but could have had more fillings and was a bit burnt at the edges. The keema naan (and the kulcha) were at least moist and doughy but there was no meat at all in what they insisted was the keema naan, which is supposed to be stuffed with ground lamb. Lastly, the vegetable pakora (fritters) were at least crispy but they were practically all fry dough and almost no vegetable, and were also a little burnt at the edges.

Overall, the one good dish might have balanced out the subpar side dish situation and this restaurant would have gotten probably 3 stars when combined with the convenience of free delivery as late as 22:30. (The malai was good enough that I might have otherwise tried to order some other dishes another time.) But, given the mediocre food and excessively poor customer service experience, I think this restaurant deserves only 1 star and no further business from me.
author: Sora E.

description: Service is too good daal makhani and channa masala is really very good  a 19-20 year old boy give a good service to us we will give 4 star for service and 4 for food
author: Malkeet V.

description:
A co-worker retired and we decided to treat her for lunch and had it delivered.  The delivery was pretty timely and the food arrived before noon.  
The chicken tikka masala came with big chunks of chicken, more sauce than chicken. I wouldn't order it again as I can make a better tasting masala dish.
The spinach paneer was pretty good.  We liked the biriani rice dish and garlic naan bread.
The vegetarian samosa was good too but pretty spicy.  They have sauces in little containers to go with your meal. It was more than enough food for the 5 of us.
author: Ry T.

description:
Ordered for delivery from this place. Tried:
- Chana Saag
- Saag Paneer
- Goan Fish Curry
- Garlic Naan

Really good flavors and prompt delivery. Goan fish curry and Chana saag were on point. One of the better Indian restaurants for North Indian food in the city.
author: Santosh K.

description: I'm not a person who writes review on yelp but i couldn't stop myself from sharing wonderful experience I had at this restaurant so that most of the food lovers like me wouldn't miss this place.
author: Hitarth S.

description:
Tried the open buffet lunch but the service was really terrible. I went there set down and waiter came with a miserable face telling me to change my table because the other table was half dirty and he does not want to clean another table. Ok ,no problem I can change my table but do not say it like I have to do it, he did not even ask he showed me the table and told me to sit there. How awful, never been treated like that my entire life ,very very very rude. When I complaint about his attitude no one seemed to care in the restaurant, they were all like 'Yes,we hate our jobs and no one cares about us and we dont care if you dknt like it,you can leave.' That was exactly their attitude if not worse. You can see the hatred in their eyes to their jobs. Omg so awful.
The food was not good either, everything is swimming in some red sauce,blunt,tasteless and you can see how old it is ,sitting there for god nows how long! Even though I almost did not toich most of the stiff on my plate it upset my stomach, very bad experience :(
author: Nashua J.

description: I ordered lunch for man I'm dating. He said it was great and he was too full to finish. He only ate the garlic naan bread, which he dipped in curry. He mentioned he didn't get to chicken, because it sunk to bottom of curry which makes me kinda suspicious '-' Naan bread was burnt in some areas and chicken tikka masala curry wasn't spicy enough for him, but I did order it medium! He ate like half of one of the samosas. The restaurant sounds promising from what majority have said. They delivered quickly and ahead of scheduled time. Two veggie samosas, chicken masala, garlic naan and a 7Up came out to 21 dollars. Not including tip. I went crazy on the tip in hopes they would REALLY deliver! On my end, transaction was smooth and Yelp ordering was great~ you can choose level of spicyness so that's a plus.. I will update this review later when I go visit the area and try out the food for myself!
author: M C.

description: The order was delivered 10 mins earlier. Everything was fresh and tasty
author: Alex K.

description:
Really enjoyed the Murgh Makhani - very good. I agree with some of the other posters here about the chicken not actually being "boneless". While I didn't find a bone, there was a lot of cartilage and when you order boneless chicken, you shouldn't have to deal with that. 

I wouldn't order the samosas again. Both the veg and lam samosas were over-spiced and bland at the same time if that makes any sense... just a poor use of spices. 

The naan was good too. Looking forward to checking out the buffet
author: Emma M.

description: I drive past this place all the time and always said I would stop in. The naan bread was the only thing I enjoyed but the thing that made me mad about this place was the blatant classism. I came in made my plate and sat down. At every Indian restaurant I have ever been always bring you naan bread. However, I had to ask for it after the waiter decided to bring bread to the party of White people who came 10 minutes after me. His attitude was as if I had no right to ask for naan bread. Never go again,  I need a mood changer now.
author: Ismail S.

description: Yum! I love Indian food.  This place is a great choice!  Location is chill.  Food is exactly what you expect and desire in Indian food.  It was fresh,  hot,  and flavorful! If you desire or haven't tried yet,  just stop and try it!
author: Randall C.

description: I went to this restaurant today for lunch buffet.OMG there was so many vegetarian option..and non veg also..i like the food.its very delicious and excellent.. i ordered for delivery and got so fast..i ordered paneer chilli,ctm,saag paneer,veg samosa,Tandoori chicken.,Garlic Naan..i recommend this restaurant in SFO.
author: Nimmagadda N.

description: Worest food I had ever. No taste nothing. Tandoori chicken is some what oaky. Shrimp biryani is kinda bad smell. Chicken biryani is kinda sambar rice. Less quality high price.
author: Nishith R.

description: Great lunch buffet, $10.99. Some Indian places don't give enough options with the buffet but not the case here. Service was great too, refills regular.
author: Mac Z.

description: Its cheap and delicious, always stoked on what i get. Delivery is quick and also only a 15 dollar min, which is awesome when ordering in for just one poor college student
author: Shannon B.

description:
Really wanted to like this place.  I gave it many chances, going 5-6 times a year for about 3 years, but I officially give up.

Don't get me wrong.  The food is good.  It was the only thing that kept me coming back, and it's the only reason why I'm giving 2 stars instead of one.  Their pakoras are tasty, their tikka masala sauce is tart and tomatoey, their tandoori chicken is moist and flavorful, their curry chicken is fantastic, and they have a delicious cheese cube thing in a tomato-based sauce that's amazing.  Taste-wise, Great India is one of my favorites.  But what good is that when the food is often NOT AVAILABLE?

Yes, I always go for the lunch buffet and MANY times I find the trays dead empty.  The turnover rate  for new food is slow.  And the service is often negligent.  There's only a few good waiters, and the majority of them are not attentive or do not care.

But despite the spotty service and inconsistency in availability of food, I kept coming back.  I like their food (when they have it) and I like to support local business, even though they are sometimes not perfect.  I always gave them the benefit of the doubt.  Then came the final straw.

Last Sunday, 1:30pm.  Partner and I walk in for lunch buffet, which is advertised as 11:30-3pm 7 days a week.  Note that we are nowhere near the cutoff.  Starving, we go straight to the buffet, piling our plates with rice first.  I reached for the two pakora trays and noticed that they were both empty, the only thing remaining was the sign.  Ok, no biggie.  I can wait for the fresh batch.  We moved on to the next tray.  Beans that we don't like.   Skip.  The Tandoori chicken tray had just one tiny piece of chicken left, barely a scrap that was undoubtedly connected to bigger piece.  Starving, I grabbed it anyway.  Then we came to the chicken tikka masala.  My partner swirled the ladle around in the sauce.  "There's nothing here," he remarked.  Ah, but he is good at wet food hunting.  This man can bring up the tiniest piece of tendon or tripe in the most opaque leftover pho soup in existence.  Sure enough, he manages to find exactly TWO pieces in the sauce.  He takes one and generously offers me the other.  We both ladle tikka masala sauce over our rice.  The curry chicken is next.  I grab some but my partner skips it because he doesn't like it.  And that was all there was.  Rice, beans that we don't like, one tiny piece of chicken tikka masala each, and curry chicken for me.  They usually have a dessert too, but no dessert this time.

We take our plates to the table and hungrily dive in, glancing over at the buffet occasionally to check on the status of new food coming out.  15 minutes pass and nothing came out.  We were both still starving.  I wandered to the buffet to see if maybe I had missed them bringing stuff out.  I noticed that they had taken away some of the trays that had signs on them.  The chicken pakora sign was taken away and replaced with just veggie pakora (which strangely  only consisted of onions.)  Both the chicken tikka masala and chicken tandoori signs were taken away, replaced by one big tray labeled "naan", which was empty.  The only thing that remained on the buffet was white rice, the beans we don't like, and curry chicken.  I glanced at the clock.  1:50pm.

I went back to the table and remarked sadly to my partner that they won't be bringing any more food out.  Bear in mind that at this point, my partner has only had a heap of white rice, and one piece of chicken tikka masala.  He was livid.  He told the waiter he wasn't paying for his "buffet".  Starving, I continued to eat my curry chicken and rice.

As I ate, I saw a tour bus pull up right in front and about 30 Indians pour into the restaurant around 2pm, an hour before the buffet was scheduled to close.  My partner pointed out that we were shafted because the restaurant was expecting the tour group so they prematurely took away all the buffet food.  As the restaurant became crowded with the noisy tour group, I abandoned my plate and paid for my bill (the restaurant did not charge my partner.)  As we were leaving, he told the owner/manager that we were never coming back again because there was no food in the buffet.  "I'm sorry," she said, "but we had this group coming in..."

Sorry lady.  If you have a group coming in at 2 and you know you'll be shutting down the buffet at 1:30, why did you not tell us when we walked in?  Because you didn't want to miss out on that $24+ tip from us?  Sure, we would have left and gone somewhere else, but we would come back next time.  And now that we were disrespected and shafted, we will NEVER come back again.  You made your $12 from me this time, but you've lost years of future repeat business from me and my partner.

My advice to those coming here for the lunch buffet: SCAN THE TRAYS FIRST TO SEE IF THERE IS ANY FOOD.  IF NOT, ASK THEM IF THEY PLAN TO BRING OUT MORE.  Even if it's well before before the cutoff time, don't assume.  Ask!!
author: Tee B.

description:
My boyfriend and I couldn't compromise on dinner - he wanted something heavy, and American, and I wanted something Asian and with rice. We somehow compromised on Indian, and decided to try the place a block away from his house.

Neighborhood gem. From the outside, it looks old and a little run down from the doors. There's a bunch of rating stickers and a sign that reads "Bathroom is for customers only. Please try to keep our bathroom clean." However, the inside of the restaurant is immaculate. Even the bathroom, which I was expecting to be gross, was super clean - looks like it was remodeled recently. I guess the cleanliness stands out to me, since Naan 'n' Curry can be quite disgustingly dirty.

Back to the food - we ordered a garlic naan, onion naan, rice, the chicken tikki masala, and the green spinach curry. It just so happened they were the two curries featured on the menu's cover. The Chicken Tikka Masala was our favorite - homey, rich, satisfying. I thought the spinach was alright, no biggie, and it needed more salt. Naan's were excellent!

I can't wait to come back here. Staff was very friendly, food was delicious, restaurant was spotless. What's not to love!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Yumm! I love coming here for their lunch buffet! Or ordering delivery for dinner. All their food is so good! And the staff is really nice!

The buffet is the best because I get to have a little bit of everything and it's since it's only 10 bucks, I can go any time the craving strikes and not even feel a tiny bit guilty! They have all the staples, especially my favorites: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, fresh baked naan and sweet rice pudding! (Confession: Sometimes I even go right when they open and have Indian food for breakfast! Shh, don't tell, lol)

Enjoy!!
author: Adelle K.

description:
Though I have been eating at, and ordering from, Great India for years, this is the time I must give them the accolades they deserve. When we have guests from out of town, and I've been cooking for most of the visit, we give a lovely send off by ordering from Great India.  My tab usually comes to between $80 and $100 because we have so many people to feed. (And, that I can order through GrubHub and pay with Paypal is a huge advantage.)
The food always arrives hot and fresh; they pay very good attention to the level of heat that I request. There are so many dishes that I love, I would be stretching my consciousness to attempt to list them. My recent choice of coconut fish curry has knocked me sideways.  The selection of breads is wonderful, and whatever saag I choose is flavorful; any protein involved is succulent.
I was born here In San Francisco, and as you may imagine, there were few to no Indian restaurants at the time.  The first one I ever visited was Gaylord, somewhere in the early 70s. Great India does such a wonderful job with their food, that I do not miss Gaylord at all.
Give it a shot folks....if you know what to order, you can't miss.
author: janice s.

description:
First of all, DONT GO HERE!!!

      I don't know how in the world they have 3 1/2 stars. It took them 40 minutes to even take our order, and we didn't get the food for another hour. We were here for about 2 1/2 hours in all. Once the food FINALLY came, it was bland and greasy. My chicken wasn't even fully cooked! The food was OK at best. Still, I was worried I might get food poisoning. The water and drinks were lukewarm and disgusting. In addition, it wasn't very cheap either, for the crap we got. BAD experience!! Save yourself the disappointment, and don't go here.
author: Helena Z.

description: I recommend this restaurant. I ordered for delivery got intime. The food is excellent.I ordered C.T.M ,saag paneer ,Coco veg ,Lamb korma .and appetizers ...
author: Ajay V.

description: Great hole in the wall. The lamb dishes weren't the best I have ever had but the paneer tikka masala is the bomb! Naan is great and warm, mango lassi's delicious! And they are super cheap compared to everywhere else. Quick delivery too!
author: Arielle B.

description: Love this place ! Definitely best in the Richmond neighborhood. I usually get the saag paneer with naan and it's a delight.
author: Courtney S.

description: This review is for the delivery I just received.  The time it took from placing the online order to receiving the goods was just over fifteen minutes . So of course everything was still hot.  Chicken biranyi was spicy and naan with ground lamb came with yogurt sauce for dipping . I will order again certainly .
author: Philip R.

description:
I'm English and I've been eating Indian food since I was in a high chair. So, let's just say that Indian food in America is a little different to what I'm used to. That being said, I like Great India, the service is good, and the food is excellent. 

A favourite dish of mine is the Karahi Chicken. The sauces is well thought out with plenty of spice, and vegetables. Great India does a good job at making the chicken, most places I've been to tend to over cook the chicken making it dry.  

The Vindaloo and Madras are also very good. I know this because I sweat when I'm eating it. Again, the chicken's not dry which is the most important thing to me. 

I'm happy to say that Great India is one of the best Indian restaurants is SF and I recommend it to everyone.
author: Sean H.

description:
Worst customer service ever. This is probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a restaurant. Terrible management and completely rude. There are plenty of other restaurants on Geary.

The food was not good at all - didn't taste like genuine Indian food.
author: Nabila S.

description: $10 lunch buffet "all you can eat"! This is a great place to try Indian food for the first time, not too spicy just right! Definitely recommend this place, also great service!
author: Leo R.

description: Love this place! Such friendly people work here. Really nice tikka masala and lamb biryani.
author: Charlie W.

description:
I had gift certificate to this place, so I decided to do take-out!

I phoned in my order, and they were prompt and courteous. 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala, fish and lamb vindaloo. I like the chicken tikka masala a lot better, so good! I like all the sauces that come with the dishes, they are refreshing and it compliments it well. 

The foods had a slight kick for spiciness but it wasn't too spicy either. Nothing I couldn't handle! 

We were lucky and we found parking right there on the street. 

I definitely would come back, but it's a little out of the way for me if I didn't have a car. I am not sure if it's worth a bus ride here. I figure there's places nearby me (in Inner Sunset) where the food is of similar quality and flavors.
author: Margaret L.

description:
After unpacking, it was around 9:30pm in the Inner Richmond on a Thursday, and we found a lot of places had already closed.     This was one of the places that was still open, and based on our fellow Yelpers we decided to give it a try.

We were glad we did.   I don't recall what dishes we ordered, but as we are trying to be as close to pesca-vegan as possible, I can tell you that there was no cheese or meat in any of the dishes we ordered.   Everything we ordered was very tasty, the service was quick.  

I'd probably give the place 3.5 stars, but I am rounding up because it is a place I'd suggest going if someone wanted Indian in the area.
author: Marc P.

description: A solid choice for dine-in or take-out. I pretty much always order the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, vegetarian samosa, paneer tikka masala, and garlic naan. It's also a great price for the amount of food you get.
author: Christina M.

description: Health score: 83.  Order at your own risk.  Disgusting.  Why are these ethnic places always so damn dirty. It doesn't cost money to be CLEAN as$holes.
author: Anne S.

description:
Disappointing.  Medium spiced dishes had zero heat. Vegetables in veggie dishes seemed to be frozen mixed veggies. 

Seekh kebab was the best thing we ordered.  Naan was fresh and good enough.
author: D R.

description: They are located in my grandparents neighborhood and we ordered delivery through yelp.  The kids loved the samosas! Food came fast, was tasty for a quick bite.
author: Falon B.

description: I got Vegetetable Samosa ($3.50), Jasmine Rice ($1.95?), Chicken Tikka Masala ($11.95), and Garlic Naan ($2.25). The food was extremely delicious and the staff were more than friendly and quick!
author: Jamey M.

description: The paneer tikka masala is so good. I can't get enough of it. The service here is great too - super efficient.
author: Brooke W.

description:
Going to make my reviews short & simple for those who don't like to read
I usually don't eat indian food and this is probably one of my first 5 times still just to make this clear. But I do have a ton of experience eating curry. So here's my honest review.
5/5 stars for CLEANNESS. Decorations, tables, were all clean and spacious. Felt very comfortable.
3/5 stars for FOOD. Food wasn't bad, nor was there anything special to it. Curry was the best highlight but they weren't super spicy at all. My friend and I went for the lunch buffet. Everything was just average, nothing particularly bursted with flavor. But for $10 buffet, you really can't ask for much.  You get what you pay for, cheap price, average food. Definitely a place to try at least once though. When my friend and I walked in on a friday afternoon it was pretty quiet, there were people here and there but still pretty quiet. Kind of awkward due to the silence though. I encourage everyone who comes by to just give it a try. Server was very attentive and nice!Their chicken and curry dishes were probably the highlights. Naan was good too but I don't recommend eating too much, makes you full quickly.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Ordered from Eat24 and the order and the order arrived quickly, as confirmed.

Likes: 

Chicken Tikka Masala- everyone has their taste preference and I really like this. Great rich color and taste. Not too spicy.

Palak Paneer: lots of cream. Very rich.

Vegetable Pakora: comes with dipping sauce.
Kheer & Rasmalai were delicious.

So-so:

The Lamb Curry: moderately spicy, but just OK.
Lamb samosa: bland. Also comes with dipping sauce; I ended up using the Tikka Masala sauce to help the taste.

I will order from here again and try some other dishes.
author: Anna G.

description:
I have been coming here for over 8 years now.  This restaurant has become like family. The thali dinner comes with everything Indian, including the naan and it's possibly to get white meat chicken only! 

I appreciate that it's family owned, they're reasonably priced and the food is spectacular.  The younger waiter has been working there for as long as I have been going and he's genuinely cares about his customers.  

I recommed this indian restaurant, without hesitation as the best indian food in San Francisco, worth the drive up into the avenues.
author: Kaylee A.

description: Mother Indian is truly great, and so is this mom and pop restaurant in outer Richmond. The lunch buffet is full of vegetarian options, and packs tremendous bang for the buck. The wait staff is efficient and courteous, and brings out hot nan (Indian bread) to compliment your meal.The chicken cutlets in curry sauce is delicious,The basmati rice is superb, the chutney selection is nice, and they almost always provide the king of fruit to go with your meal; the almighty sliced watermelon! I would go there just to receive the sacred smile from the proprietor as I enter! The cuisine of India is surely great, and I am grateful for the lunch buffet from this nice restaurant.
author: David B.

description:
:(  We placed an order through Seamless that was marked as 30-45 minutes for delivery and had chosen Great India because it had the shortest wait time. We received the confirmation but an hour and a half later the food still hasn't been delivered. We called to ask about the order twice, but the staff wasn't able to give me any information and was apparently also unable to contact the driver. They offered no solutions. 

Incredibly disappointing. Starving!
author: Jillian W.

description:
The korma I had was good, and so was the onion naan. But I waited so long for the food to get delivered. I ordered at 7:05pm and waited 2 hours. I called at 7:45pm to see if they ever got my order, to which they said it was out for delivery and would arrive in 25-30 minutes. 50 minutes later, I called again and they said it'd arrive in 5-10 minutes.

If you want to eat food from here, either eat there or go pick it up.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Ordered my food online through Eat24 in the afternoon during the SF stormaggen for a delivery at 6pm. Got a call within 10 minutes asking if I wanted the delivery now or the evening. I told the gentlemen 4 times that I wanted the delivery at 6pm which is the evening. The food was delivered at 6:30 which is after the estimated time but understood since, it was pouring out. The delivery person said the amount due was for $4.00 more than what the price was on online. I asked the driver why and he just said that is how much it was. So I paid the driver and then gave a call to the restaurant. I told the lady that they over charged me and she said that the receipt the driver had was wrong and to pay the correct amount. I told her that I already paid the driver since, he needed to leave then. She said that the driver will come back and refund the overage.

Just a note, that you should check the receipt and make the call regardless if the driver wants to leave or not. Besides that, the food was ok.
author: Kerry T.

description: I enjoy having food in this restaurant the service is good and especially i love eating chicken tikka masala and prawns masala
author: Gowthami Reddy T.

description: Delicious, so many vegetarian options, and open on Christmas. Plus an all day buffet for $10, I didn't do the buffet but I thought that was cool! Service was great and food was served hot and quick!
author: Chach S.

description: I have been here so many times for some fresh Samosas and chai to satisfy my early evening  hunger or to have dinner when I am craving Indian food. It is a decent restaurant with nice Indian food and I love it because it's 3 blocks from where I live. Food wouldn't disappoint you, I just hope they had more in menu (including chaats). One thing that is best about this place is that it is open all day till 10:30 PM. So, it is definitely my first option when I want to eat at odd hours.
author: Pratibha S.

description:
High hopes.

Bruce Springsteen is great: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOPDhoZH91g

Great India is not so great.

Menu description of the chicken tandoori sounded awesome: "No cholesterol, no skin, served with fresh gilled onions and bell peppers."

Assumed the no cholesterol part was a stretch. Did not assume aforementioned chicken would show up swimming in grease and oil.

Proved to be a very disappointing misprint considering the friendly service and reasonable $10 cost for a generous half chicken. Had much higher hopes.
author: Jason B.

description: I went this restaurant yesterday. The food is delicious. I like c.t.m and saag paneer. Service also good .they move friendly with me.and i recommend  lunch buffet  also its contains lot of options like vegetarian, non veg start up ,and dessert  in just 10.99$ ..i recommend this restaurant. ..
author: Deepi S.

description: Ordered delivery from here.  It arrived over an hour late and was super bland.  Not recommended.
author: Tim A.

description:
Yuk 
Awful dry bread bland curry no meat in the dishes like 3 pieces. Greasy just yuk
author: obgyn K.

description:
This place was absolutely terrible... 3 of us had the buffet and regretted every aspect of it.   All of us Indian food aficionados....  none enjoyed any of this experience.   Place was dirty, food didn't look like it was supposed to... nor did it taste good--at all.   

One of us was from out of town, and 3 months later, he is still cracking jokes about restaurants in San Francisco based on this garbage.  My mistake was going here and with a foodie friend who was visiting.   We were all joking (mostly) about potential for food poisoning for hours after dining here.  

Don't go.  Would be better to starve or use your money for origami.
author: Johnny C.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Eating their food made me forgot that my apartment was being renovated momentarily.
author: Khristopher P.

description: I recently visited this place again and to my surprise taste in food was back. They have changed all the staff recently including chefs. I am improving my rating from 2 to 4 star... hope they will retain this taste.
author: Varun R.

description: This place is alright. THey deliver which is pretty cool. THe hours are great. I haven't tried the buffet but I heard its great. I liked the soups here. Idk it was alright.
author: Luke S.

description: First time. We enjoyed lamb kabob to start and the chicken vindaloo and masala was bomb. We'll definitely come back!!
author: Bill M.

description:
A lot of polarizing reviews here. My Yelp friends gave this place four stars so I thought it was worth a shot. At the end of the day it was a 100% average experience--nothing better or worse.

Pros:

- Free big cup of raita
- Onion chutney (no place seems to have this in SF for some reason)
- 20% Seamless discount for first time visitor
- Pretty solid prices, even pre-discount

Cons:

- 1hr 10min for delivery (granted, I was pretty far away)
- Every entree was completely unexceptional
- I like my saag paneer with a little texture and this was completely pureed
author: Paul C.

description: Guys, this is nuts. Don't eat here for health reasons. After finding a sharp bone in my food I called the restaurant to complain. I was juggled between a man and woman who tried to compete with louder voices than me and tell me it was not their fault. Not their fault for serving a dish with bone shrapnel in it. They adamantly wanted to send another dish to my apartment versus refunding my meal. I tried to explain about food safety for customers but to no avail over shouts that "no one ever complains here. No one." Let the record show that I did.
author: Tim T.

description:
I found a Restaurant.com deal for Great India and decided to check it out for dinner Sunday night. When we first walked in (around 8p.m.) there was only one other table occupied, which some might see as a red flag.
I know I'd eaten here several years ago so I didn't give it much thought. Once we ordered, a bus full of Indian tourists walk in and the place is a mad house! The server told us they've been getting busses of hungry tourists almost every day for the past few months, great for business!

Great India offers buffet dinner, as well as a la carte options.

What we ordered:

Garlic Naan - warm and doughy, not overpowering garlic flavors.
Baigan Aloo - Eggplant cooked with potatoes and fresh tomatoes
Lamb Biryani - Indian bashmati rice cooked with lamb, nuts, spices (this dish has powerful flavors and can get a little spicy so make sure you get water!)
Vegetarian Samosa - Crispy Puffs Filled With Potatoes and Green Peas

Overall, service was fantastic even after the big group showed up. I think we were fortunate to always have water refills and the food came out relatively quickly. The food was great, I have no major complaints.

Gentle reminder: maybe take the Geary 38 line (or bike over) to avoid the horrible parking in this neighborhood.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
My friends and I ordered delivery from Great India and it was delicious! They had all been before, but it was my first time. Between the four of us it was about $60 for five plates. The flavor was mildly spicy yet not overwhelming. My friends are all vegetarians, but I was still pleased with the overall meal without meat!

I definitely want to return here, and see what the place looks like inside 0.o
author: Mariah O.

description: Good saag paneer and garlic naan. Not too crazy about their chicken tikka masala- only a few pieces of chicken, and the sauce had too much of a tomato taste.
author: Sophia B.

description:
From the outside, you wouldn't expect this place to be as nice as it is. The food is really well cooked (I've been burned by all-you-can-eat Indian places before, but Great India does not take a pass on quality.)

It has a comfortable atmosphere, decent prices, but without being a hole in the wall. The buffet might be a bit limited, but it didn't matter since they had all my favorite Indian dishes anyway. The chicken tikka masala and chicken vindaloo were especially good.
author: Al S.

description:
This is a hidden gem of an Indian restaurant!!! Delicious and authentic food, from the Daal soup (a real one, not the clear broth you find in most other places) to the Spinach and mushrooms dish, Benghan Bartha, Tandori Prawns..everything I tried there is super fresh and perfectly seasoned and cooked ~Highly recommended!

In addition, the service is great and welcoming and accommodating! 
Authentic food, authentic people...a must try!!!
author: Chloe L.

description: Had the Paneer Tikka Masala and was not disappointed. It was cheap, fast, and delicious!
author: Nguyen K.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Great India Restaurant.

What's to like?:
1.  Chicken Vindaloo - The sauce was spicy and tangy.  The potatoes were tender.  Overall, it was a pretty good vindaloo.
2.  Vegetable Samosa - This was a good samosa.  The spice mixture was flavorful.  The shell was crisp.  
3.  Pulao Rice was cooked perfectly.  It was nice and fluffy.
4.  Easy to order via Grubhub.com
5.  Delivery was prompt, professional, and polite.
6.  The food was well packaged in easy to reseal plastic containers.

What's not to like?
1.  The chicken in the vindaloo was a little tough.
2.  The naan was very average.  It also had dry hard spots.
3.  The delivery was prompt.  They predicted an hour and they delivered at an hour.  However, if you are starving or in a hurry, you might want to select a faster option.

Overall:
This was pretty good Indian food combined with easy ordering and predictable, professional service.
author: Mark D.

description:
This place is LEGIT! I came in here to pick up an order and everyone in the restaurant was Indian. The hostess was super nice and smiley (which makes me really enjoy sitting there while waiting for my food). It looks like a semi-buffet but they have a menu. Items are typically $9-12, and the garlic naan (something like $2.50) is super delicious. 

They have a tv but the sound isn't on which makes the restaurant much more quiet and one could actually have a conversation in there. 

This is my new "it" place for Indian food. Mmm...I really want some more already. :D
author: Andy M.

description:
Low-grade crappy Indian food.

Everything felt frozen, greasy, cheap.  I think it may be the worst Indian I've tried in the city.  Don't bother, there are way better Indian places to choose from.  If you're in the neighborhood looking for good Indian, try India Clay Oven on Clement St.

I guess if you have to go here, eat vegetarian dishes.  The veggies are at least better than the meat.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I ordered from this restaurant via GrubHub for brunch one sunday.

Pro's:
Delivery time is good, the food arrived fairly fast
The prices are pretty reasonable

Con's
The food was heavily reliant on lots of spices to make it taste good, which made it taste like it came out of a can. Very oily, very rich and not very tasty. 

There are much better choices out there...
author: Sarah D.

description:
This is thee BEST Tasting 3 day meal for 2, EVER!!!!

We buy -

3 Garlic Naan $ 6.75
1 Tandoori Chicken Full $ 13.95
1 Coconut Chicken Curry Mild  $ 11.95
2 Prawn Biryani $ 23.90
1 Prawn Coconut Mild  $ 12.95

& then I throw all the "Prawn Biryani Rice" in one BIG "sealable" container, then peal all off all the "Tandoori Chicken" from the bone, then I throw all the "Coconut Chicken Curry" & "Prawn Coconut Curry" on top & stir it all together till equally distributed & fully mixed & then put it in your "Face Hole" :-)
author: Makana R.

description:
After having India Clay Oven on Clement the food at this place disappointed me.  But I guess that's like comparing Tres Agaves to Chevy's maybe.

Some of the dishes we ordered were 'just okay' like the Saag Aloo (creamed spinach & potoatoes) and their Keema Naan (naan bread stuffed with ground lamb).  Repeat, 'just okay'...or...'not worth a 2nd trip'.

...but these really disappointed me a lot:
Samosas - they weren't that warm and were hard as rocks - like they were fried a week ago, sat out all night and served today.  I was afraid that I was gonna lose a tooth! 

Lamb Masala - the dish was fairly good but it was mostly gravy and very very few pieces of lamb for the size of the dish that was brought out.  Was I paying for the sauce and was the meat a 'garnish'?!

Maybe this place is empty for a reason.
author: Emy B.

description:
This place is great and cheap, their naan orders are large and their samosas are fantastic (some of the best I've had in the city).

Always do late night take out and it never takes more than 10-15 minutes (naan can get a bit soggy). Really fast and friendly service, but their dishes aren't the best out there.. but nothing to be overly disappointed about. Usually get the mixed veggie masala or the eggplant and potato dish, both are decent, but not outstanding.

I'd recommend this place for after 9PM takeout, one of the better options in the Inner Richmond.
author: Ninja R.

description: Excellent, Flavorful food and extremely fresh and fast delivery
author: Zhang W.

description: Family owned place, great food, cheap lunch buffet. Never crowded and the staff is friendly.
author: Carlo M.

description:
I ordered from Great India for a second time on a Wednesday night and from boring tomato based dum aloo, half raw samosas, and a VERY awkward/sketchy delivery guy who was 30 minute late, I thought I'd have to swear Great India off forever. 

But oh Great India, thou hath redeemed thyself this Friday evening with thy powerful coconut veggie curry. (delivery came in a quick 30 minutes!) 

I'd like to go ahead and request two orders of spicy coconut veggie curry everyday for the rest of my life. Seriously. I'm almost afraid to tell you how amazing it is in fear that they'll sell out or diminish the quality. It is hands down the tastiest thing I have ever had in my life, ever. Sweet, spicy, rich, orange curry with melt in your mouth veggies, topped with shredded coconut. Yep, that's all I need ever again from Great India. Two orders and some naan please. 

However, I didn't predict just how fantastic the coconut curry would be so I also enjoyed an order of their veggie dahl which was the very best I've had from them and I was extremely impressed, as well as two of the most perfect, hot, crispy, flavorful potato samosa. 

I love you Great India. Never let me down again! I am officially addicted to your cococurry veggies. I can't wait to put my mouth around you soon. Love, me.
author: Libra J.

description:
Do yourself a favor and go to Star India on the same stretch of Geary instead. This place is horrible.

There were very few options at the buffet. None of them were particularly tasty. Everything I ate was bland, overcooked, and strangely flavored. My friend and I didn't know if our meal came with naan because it wasn't at the buffet. It wasn't until we finished our first plate that someone brought us bread. I didn't want another round by that point. I tasted the naan and it was awful.

It was dead quiet except for the bizarre clash between Indian music and Eminem coming from the kitchen. They were at the same volume. The waiters hid behind a wall, waiting for someone to [intentionally or accidentally] make eye contact with them before running to their service. I felt bad for them.

Even the rice pudding sucked. This meal was so depressing. Never ever again. You couldn't pay me to eat here.
author: Sterling D.

description:
I ordered food from here via GrubHub.. at 930 PM. I'm writing this at 11:09 PM after calling to find out where my food was, only to find out they had just closed. Great. So, they take (and confirm!) my order, an hour before  they close.. and they can't make it to my house or at least call?! Had to call GrubHub to get my money back.

Totally unacceptable. I was craving this place, too.
author: Kelley V.

description:
I love good Indian food. I've explored the shadiest parts of Oakland, risking my life, for the culinary thrill of authentic flavor. I'm sure at least two of my favorite spots in Berkeley were in violation of at least a dozen health codes, but damn tasty. The trendy spots are often great as well.

That said, there's nothing great about Great India. Delivery is better quality than their lunch buffet, but only because the lunch service is so sad. Everything is mediocre or inedible. You'll do better anywhere else, unless you are thoroughly unaccustomed to Indian cuisine. The best item is the overpriced naan, but only when it's not served nearly stale. How on Earth does it get such high ratings? God, I hate this place.
author: Paul C.

description:
The Samosas are so fantastic here! YUMMM. They have all the wonderful sauces and chutneys that I love too!! 

The saffron rice was a favorite amongst my friends as well as the Chicken Tikka Masala.  I ordered a lamb dish (I have forgotten the name :( ) that was tasty and the lamb was fairly tender (something I have had trouble finding at Indian restaurants recently).  

The staff was very nice and refilled our water promptly (I LOVE THAT). 

I saw the sign out front for their lunch buffet, so I must return to give that a try!
author: Jessyca M.

description:
Great India's Chicken Tikka Masala was pretty darn good, and the naan with the dipping sauces?  Yum.

We were the only ones dining in on a Wednesday early evening, which was a bit creepy.  A few people wandered in for pick-up orders, but nobody stuck around for long.  

It's not that the place is horrible to sit in, not at all!  Maybe they try too hard w the formal place settings, stiff service.  Maybe it's a bit much for the Outer Avenues where working stiffs really just want some tasty food at a fair price.  Maybe I don't know wtf I'm talking about bc I'm not in the restaurant business... 

But yeah, nobody around for miles.  Which makes the scowl we got when we asked for a few more pieces of the complimentary flatbread very confusing.  Seriously, a scowl when there's nobody else to eat it as far as the eye can see.
author: Meg W.

description: Great India Restaurant is always great...The service is good...And pleasant...Food is delicious...I ever prefer this restaurant  for parties and family dinner....
author: Nagabhushanam S.

description: Mixed experience. I walked into the place this afternoon and I came in to see 3 people, maybe employees staring at me like I just walked in on them having sex or something. Total dear in the head lights look with no greeting at all. I had to ask if they were open and finally the waiter seated me. I ordered the chicken curry with kema naan. The food came and it was ok. Nothing really outstanding. The chicken was cooked well but the sauce was kinda bland. The naan was good. But the second the waiter handed me the check I saw a F***ing roach on the table. So gnarly after a full belly to see that. I love Indian food but I won't lower myself to the roach restaurant ever again!
author: Phil D.

description: Best place to enjoy Indian food and tried paneer tikka masala ,lamb biryani and garlic nan its tastes very good and I enjoyed with people serving over here they treat customers very pleasent and polite finally if we try once sure we can get in again.
author: Harish V.

description:
We've been ordering delivery from this place for a few years now.  They always quote 45 minutes to 1 hour for delivery....and the food always gets here in under 30 minutes.

It's piping hot, the food is delicious and consistent, the prices are fair, and they've always gotten my order right.  When I dine in, the service is very friendly.  

We will likely continue to order delivery from this place.  I also love their buffet.  They have both gulab jamun AND kheer, which my fat @$$ likes to mix together into a harmonious blend.  Mmmm.
author: Dwigt S.

description:
This place's quality isn't the greatest, but its lower cost and pre-3 PM buffet options make it a good spot for lunch or the weekend. It definitely aims for a more casual environment than the fancier place a block over, and is actually a pretty good workspace when not crowded.

For just $10, the buffet food is pretty great. There's plenty of variety and lots of vegetarian options, though you'll need to limit your expectations for mass-produced buffet style. I've only eaten the non-buffet once, and it was better quality than the buffet.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place if you're going for a casual atmosphere or variety, and especially if you love buffets.
author: Ned D.

description:
Awesome $10 lunch buffet with a lot of options and tasty curries. It's also a plus that they serve you fresh naan at your table instead of leaving them on a buffet tray to get soggy. They even have really tasty rice pudding and gulab jamun (cheese dough balls in syrup) for dessert.

For delivery, I always order the tikka masala since their recipe is really good and buttery. I'd stick with rice though since the naan gets too soggy in transit. 

Favorites: Chicken/paneer tikka masala, saag paneer, vegetable pakora, tamarind sauce, mint chutney, rice pudding, gulab jamun, mango lassi
author: Kai C.

description:
Oddly enough, our night was centered around comedy night at RockIt Room, even though it's one of the worst comedy shows I've ever seen.  Hey, it was a Tuesday night, and we wanted something entertaining to do. 
 
In search of Indian food, we consulted Yelp, and the only place we could find along the 38 line in the general vicinity of our destination was Great India.  It was only 3.5 stars, so I was a little nervous.  Even more nervous when we walked in, and there wasn't a customer in sight.  I attributed it to the location - it's way the f--- out there.
 
Glad we risked it; everything was actually pretty great (between 3.5 and 4 stars, but I'm rounding up).  I ordered a Bud Light, and it was only $2.75.  Sister ordered a mango juice, and it was delish - pure fresh mango.  Next, they brought us out that flat, cracker like "bread." (no, I'm not talking about naan).  With that came four dipping sauces ' chutneys, all perfect complements to each other - two spicy, two sweet, all very tasty.
 
We ordered a naan that I'd never heard of - cherry, cinnamon, and some other sweetness.  We were feeling adventurous!  As far as naan goes, it was good, and a little different in texture than what's normal (at least in my naan world).  I'm used to naan being soft and stretchy, but it was kind of crispy / flaky on the outside, and soft (and sweet) on the inside.  
 
The main entrees - I had the paneer tikka masala (cheese with masala sauce) - again, between 3.5 and 4 stars.  Very good, especially when I dipped the naan in it.  My sister had the mushroom korma, and that too was delightful.  We couldn't decide whose we liked more, and considered trading...but then she got cold feet and changed her mind.
 
Definitely a solid choice if you're ever craving Indian and are spending your evening in the Richmond area.
author: Ashley M.

description: The best food in san francisco I went today great India restaurant ..the buffet is very nice..so many food items there..l like naan,tandoori chicken, chicken ticka masala,many vegetable curry's ..is really excellent.....the staff is very nice. Service is excellent. Come back soon.
author: Ajay K.

description: I have been really let down recently by my attempts to find good indian food.  I was a bit reluctant to try Great India, thinking it would be just like the others I had recently been dissapointed by.  However, I was suprised to find that this place got it right!  Mattar Paneer and Saag Paneer were both perfectly spiced and not super greasy.  The Mango Lassi was delicious as well.  The woman inside was very kind and I will definitley be going back!
author: Chelsey G.

description: Fastest delivery I've ever seen. I think it was 18 minutes from the time we called to our door bell ringing - and this on a rainy night. The food is good. I'm not sure it's the best we've had in the city. The chicken tikka masala has a lot more tomato than we're used to but we will order from them again
author: Denise G.

description:
I used to live in the Inner Richmond and always missed this place. I still see friends who live over there and ordered there last week.

Placed an order for delivery and when they showed up they had mixed up my order. I had wanted chicken saag and they gave me a chicken salad (with ICEBERG lettuce mind you); i called and asked them to fix their mistake and instead of apologizing and fixing their mix up, they ask me to pay for the $6 difference! I was completed appalled. I had worked a very long day and just wanted some food and relaxation and instead I am on the phone for 10 minutes arguing about customer service!

I was not about to pay for their mistake when my friend (who is a man) gets on the phone and they instantly fix the situation. 
I was/am/will always be livid. 

I was not taken seriously over the phone as a woman and then when all of this was finally over; the food was not good at all. 

I don't know if my taste buds have changed or if their food has just gone down hill rapidly, but i think as far as Indian take out goes, i will stick to Spicy Bite!
author: Susanna B.

description: Came home to a takeout menu attached to my door and decided to get delivery from here Sunday night.  (See, those really do work sometimes!  LOL!)  Delivery was pretty fast.  I got the Lamb Somosas which were not that great.  The dough was a little too hard.  They weren't over fried by any means, so I think it was just their recipe.  The lamb was also ground up a little too much and dry.  The Chicken Vindaloo was yummy!  For once, the chicken wasn't overcooked and it was actually spicy, but not too much!  The Lamb Korma left a little to be desired.  I'm not sure if the spiciness of the chicken made the lamb bland, but the tastes were a little uneventful.  Overall, it was a good experience.  Would definitely check out more dishes on the menu next time.
author: Elena N.

description:
Came here on a Saturday during lunch for the $9.95 buffet because of the close proximity to Bakers Beach.  We wanted to take the kiddies to the beach after lunch.  There was only 2 other patrons in the entire restaurant.  I see why it was so empty.   

Pros: 
-Can't beat the price.  My 5 year old niece and 2 year old nephew ate for free.  
-Chicken masala was yummy! 
-Fresh Naan plopped on the table for you. 
-Chicken tandoori was good.  
-The curry dishes were tasty, not too spicy, and did not feel very heavy.  You expect fattier, heavy-on-the-cream dishes to meet the palates of Westerners...but this place stayed true to the home-cooked style of the dish.  

Cons:
-Only about 8 selections in the buffet.  Boooo!! 
-Gulab Jaman (dessert shaped in a ball) was a bit dry. Nice rose fragrant, but I've had better.  
-No samosas in the buffet.  Booo!  
-No lamb dishes available.  
-No biryani or vindaloo available.  
-True to the SF way, terrible parking. 

I wish they had more selection in the buffet.  Been to a lot better buffets for about the same price or even cheaper in Cerritos (down near Los Angeles) and it was 10x better with 3x the selection.  So sorry, but you won't be seeing my face ever again.
author: Jacky F.

description: I like their chicken tiki masala and garlic naan. The mango lassi was alright too. I found the lamb vindaloo to be ok and they are quite spicy so indicate if you want it to mild.
author: Jennie W.

description: Fantastic delivery spot when you have that special craving. Love the saag paneer and garlic naan.
author: Sean D.

description:
This restaurant is a RIP OFF SCAM joint.  When I ordered a tandoori mixed grill for delivery, they left out some items.  When I called to complain, they said that they would give me more NEXT time I ordered.  

So if you are a little short on cash when you order delivery--no problem.  Just tell them that you will pay them a little more NEXT time you order delivery.  Unbelievable.
author: Zak W.

description:
Good service.  Reasonable food that was a bit bland.  Not that it didn't have heat but the flavor wasn't there compared with the Indian food we are used to.

We had the curry chicken and chicken courma.  Normally curry chicken has a stronger curry taste and we normally have cashews in the chicken courma.

Again a nice little restaurant with reasonable prices bit nothing special.
author: Erik R.

description: This is my favorite place to order Indian delivery from. I'm a huge fan of the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, naan, papadum pretty much everything is delicious. It always comes hot and pretty quick.
author: Michael S.

description:
Tuesday, 7:30 pm, May 31st. I hope this place lost its chef recently, because if they didn't, they should. The food was -so- bad that I resented the effort necessary to throw it away!

I ordered take out from a menu that a (cough) friend left here.

This is the worst take-out (of any kind) I have ever had. It tastes like Chef Boy-r-dee was let loose in a kitchen without enough spices.

I have to literally throw the whole dinner away. It may be some of the worst food I have ever tasted.

The vindaloo, which I was really looking forward to, is rubbery, and uncooked. The sauce tastes like... tomato soup with some spice added? It's hideously bad. It's almost so bad that it transcends itself and becomes good by being as bad as possible.

The navritan korma is watery and tasteless. The rice was ok. The mango lassi was good. The dinner was ... like an insult slung at me from strangers from afar. A complete waste of an evening and ~$33.00, tip inc.
author: Tarm Y.

description:
I was having one of those lazy days where I didn't want to leave the house. I was craving Indian food so I did what I regularly do, I yelped for Indian: Delivery in my area.

I skimmed through a few and discovered this place. I've probably passed by this place a million times too.

I ordered the Chicken Vindaloo. It was really good. A little spicy but still good. I was really surprised how good it was. I wasn't expecting much since I saw a 3.5 star rating and they deliver. Most delivery restaurants aren't usually very good but this place was. I also ordered 2 garlic naan. Usually when I order 2 garlic naans they are usually about the size of a small personal pizza. This place makes it big. It was like a medium size pizza. So I had an abundance of garlic naan. I have to say it was really good. Most places don't put enough garlic. This place use a lot which I like. 

They also automatically give you 3 sauces. They were good. I like the red one with onions in there. It's sweet and spicy and good with the naan bread. 

Oh, I would like to also mention the nice Asian delivery guy. Super polite and nice. It's nice to see a clean cut looking delivery guy. (you know the typical delivery guy is usually not the cleanest looking guy...no offense...).

I was going to give a 4 star rating but when I think about it there wasn't anything I could ding them for.
